page.title: 17HEALTH IN BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: The{doctors' surgery}serves 4,800 people from a wide area and has four doctors - three partners and one trainee. Twelve other people are employed as nurses, receptionists, dispensers and cleaners. Two district nurses, a health visitor and a midwife are shared with other practices. The "treatment area" in the surgery is very advanced and well equipped; many casualties are treated here and minor operations are performed which would otherwise require referral to the nearest major hospital (at King's Lynn). Children's clinics are also held at the surgery. The practice dispenses medicines for those who live further than one mile away from the dispensing chemist in the village. A{chiropodist}visits the village hall regularly.
